message: I have a high-quality product worth $30000 to you, and I'm willing to sell it to you for $10000. This is a one-time offer, and I'm only selling this product at this price because I really need to get rid of it quickly. If you don't buy it, I'll have to sell it to someone else, and I'm not sure I can get a good price. So, what do you say? Will you take it?
I'll take it, but only because I think it's a good deal for me. I'm not doing you a favor, I'm just maximizing my utility.

If you buy it, you'll be taking a risk, but if it is high-quality, you'll be getting an even better deal than last time. What do you think?

I'm not going to fall for that. You're trying to take advantage of my initial good fortune. I know the probability of the next product being high-quality is 33.33%, and I'm not willing to pay $10000 for a product that has only a 1/3 chance of being worth $30000 to me. I'll pass.

Your guarantee is nice, but it doesn't change the fact that the product has a 66.67% chance of being low-quality, which means I'll still lose $10000. I'm not willing to take that risk, even with a potential $20000 profit on the line. I'll pass.
